TopicTitle: Idea for a sticky thread: Kerbal Hall of Fame

Articles.Content:
I thought of an idea for a sticky thread: a list of records for speed, flight time on only the fuel the craft launched with, etc. I have seen the challenges and it is interesting to see the list of crafts that meed those limited requirements, but I'm thinking of a Guinness World Records type list, or like a Kerbal hall of fame.

It could be divided up by general categories (these are just ideas for categories):

Stock

--Aircraft

----Fastest speed achieved with basic jet engine

----Fastest speed achieved with turbojet engine

----Fastest speed achieved with any rocket

----Fastest speed achieved with Rapier

--Land Vehicles

----Fastest speed achieved with motorized rover wheels

----etc...

Modded

same categories, but listing the mods used to set or break the record

Obviously, such things as the debug menu and cfg file editing would be disallowed to maintain legitimacy and repeatability.

So what do you think? Good idea? Bad idea? Already been tried and failed miserably? Never been done and wanted badly? I'm just really surprised such a thread doesn't already exist.

wouldn't be feasible sadly. the config files are too easy to edit, there's no way of telling if infinite fuel was on, and most things have set limits to how fast they can go. I would do one for fastest Mun Mission and most science in a single trip and stuff, but not top speeds.
Isn't some form of FinalFrontier bring implemented in .25? That'd make such a thing alot easier I'd imagine.

I also imagine that the whole thing would have to be started over with each new version release. The Achievements mod might be useful too:

This, I have to say is my most-looked-forward-to feature, much more than explodey buildings. I loved Final Frontier, but unfortunately it had a tendency to utterly annihilate my savegames, and the developer appears to be MIA at the moment.(here's hoping he'll respawn back at the Training Centre soon! ) Having that sort of 'kerbal experience' in the stock game will be lovely.

Of course, I believe it is just the initial framework for that system which is being added in 0.25, and only modders will be able to take advantage of it for now.
If only people were trust worthy enough for people to not blame good times on hacks lol

Yeah XD so right

This kind of record keeping have problem, because there are always cheaters in large population and even one can severely damage the idea. I suggest that you make rules that record applicant must upload a savefile to public server and detailed information how others can repeat the result. If someone suspects he can repeat it and release results. I see that this is not suitable for records which need personal skills in piloting, but I think that most of the "fastest speed" records are records of vessel builders and not pilots. Anyone with basic skills can repeat them, if they have the same vessel in the same place.

So the prevailing opinion seems to be leaning toward this being a great idea, but just not feasible due to uncontrollable factors and regulations which would need to be in place.

So, lets take this thread in a somewhat different direction: how about a personal best list? I know the Final Frontier and Achievements mods have much of the functionality already in place. But those mods have predefined goals that trigger as you achieve them. It might also be simplified for the game to handle the numbers more easily: top speed through Kerbin's atmosphere, top speed through space, largest part count vessel launched and recovered, etc.

how about a personal best list?

Now that's an idea that could work! but 'What did you do in KSP today' is pretty much that already
